item.title: Using the New PyREPL in VSCode
item.description:
The PyREPL

I use the REPL all the time and I’m enjoying the new PyREPL.
If you haven’t yet moved to Python 3.14, you should - PyREPL is another compelling reason to update.

The new PyREPL has been available since Python 3.13, and replaces the original C-based REPL with a Python-based implementation (PyREPL). You can read about the PyREPL in ‘PEP 762 â€“ REPL-acing the default REPL’.
